How to prepare plastic bottle for waste collection
Types of plastic markings and what they mean
How to prepare glassware for waste collection
How to start living the zero waste principle
Choose where you want to go
You are not logged in, you need to log in to continue
If the update is skipped, the application may be unstable
The latest version of the app is now available!
Sorry, we don\'t work in your city yet. Try a nearby major city
take the bottle to the recycling center

It is not necessary to wash the bottle with detergent until it shines. It is enough to remove the remnants of drinks, food and fat — so that they do not stick to the plastic. And, of course, you should not recycle a bottle with unfinished contents
this step is necessary if the label is shrinkable (completely fits the bottle). Labels of standard shape — narrow and encircling the bottle — do not need to be removed

The lids are made of plastic other than the material of the bottle, and they cannot be recycled together. The lids can be left on the bottles when being recycled, or they can be collected separately and handed over to projects that collect only the lids.
Squeeze the bottle so that it takes up less space and the collectors of recyclables do not have to "carry air”
Check the marking of the plastic in the triangle and take it to the waste collection point with the appropriate fraction
PET packaging is of three types:
Transparent bags, disposable tableware, cans, basins, bottle caps, cosmetic bottles, children\'s toys
It is used for electrical insulation of wires and cables, production of sheets, pipes, films for stretch ceilings, \"vinyl\" records, artificial leathers, linoleum, etc.
Basically, different types of film and tear-off caps from 20-liter bottles are made from this material

Polypropylene is used to produce car bumpers, interior trim of cars, power tool housings, chocolate packaging, bags for rice, pasta and bread, plastic cups for tea and yogurt, lids for cans and bottles.
Disposable tableware, substrate for vegetables and fruits, foam, videotapes
Such plastic is often found in food containers and plastic bottles.
cans and bottles\nthere is a characteristic point at the bottom
containers, blisters are called PET-correctors in another way
It is important to separate containers and plastic, as they have different densities and are processed separately from each other accordingly
Such plastic can emit a number of toxic substances during operation, so it is better to abandon its use in everyday life or minimize it.
It will be quite difficult for an individual to get rid of this type of raw material.

It is important to note that foamed (fruit pallets, packaging foam) and solid (containers, lids) polystyrene, although they have the same marking - "06", are processed by different methods, therefore they are collected separately.
But products that come into contact with BPA are harmful to health. In no case do not use such products in microwave ovens!
Bottles are most often accepted. \nThis type of plastic is the safest and is accepted in garbage containers of almost any home.
Just as PET bottles, HDPE packaging is accepted at all plastic reception points
Often PVC plastic is not accepted from individuals, but if you have such plastic, try to find companies or projects that are engaged in the processing of this type of plastic.
The film is not accepted in all places, so if possible, replace the film with other reusable types of packages
This type is reluctantly taken for processing, in order to be taken, you need to accumulate several tons of plastic and send it to a processing plant
Just as 05 kind, it is difficult to hand over for recycling. Although it is processed in our country, this process is not profitable for many companies.
Just as 03 is very rarely recycled, it will be extremely difficult for an individual to find companies that accept this plastic
Rinse the glass from leftover food or other products
If possible, remove the lids from the glass jars
Take the container to the waste collection point
Rings, dispensers and labels do not need to be removed from the bottle (container)
If the glass is broken, it is better to put it in a separate container. For example, in the same glass jar.
